overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish an adjudication system and procedures to process fireworks infractions, similar to the existing traffic infraction system. [1] This bill amends and establishes various definitions and penalties for firework offenses, including establishing heightened penalties under certain circumstances. [1] It also establishes various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnics and appropriates funds. [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The funds are to carry out the purposes of this Act, including to update the judiciary information management system to implement the adjudications process established by section 2 of this Act. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]

agency_impact: Creating a fireworks infractions system will allow law enforcement agencies and the judiciary to quickly and efficiently process low-level cases. [1] The judiciary is responsible for expending the appropriated funds to update its information management system to implement the new adjudication process. [1] The bill also confers concurrent jurisdiction on district courts to hear and dispose of cases of fireworks infractions by children. [1]

policy_impact: This Act establishes a dedicated adjudication system for fireworks infractions, similar to the existing traffic infraction system. [1] It amends chapter 132D, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by adding new criminal offenses and establishing heightened penalties for offenses that result in injury or death. [1] The measure also amends definitions for terms such as "aerial device" and "consumer fireworks" to provide clarity and improve enforcement of fireworks control laws. [1] [1]
